comments.body:
Not all clusters support LoadBalancer out of the box.  A number of folks use the Vagrant cluster to kick the tires on examples.  Maybe change to say if your cluster supports load balancing, do what you present.  

If your cluster does not support an external load balancer, create a ClusterIP service and maybe use the `/api/v1/proxy/namespaces/default/services/php-apache` endpoint instead to drive traffic into the cluster?
I agree with @derekwaynecarr. AFAIU we don't have to expose service as an external load balancer.

Done.
(I've added more info on it at the end of this section).

comments.body: I would add a sentence here explaining what this does, something like "This will create a horizontal pod autoscaler that maintains between 1 and 10 replicas of the Pods controlled by the `php-apache` replication controller you created in the first step of these instructions. Roughly speaking, the horizontal autoscaler will increase and decrease the number of replicas (via the replication controller) so as to maintain an average CPU utilization across all Pods of 100 millicores. See <reference to proposals/ doc here> for more details on the algorithm."
Or maybe "This defines" rather than "This will create" since technically you don't create it until you run kubectl.
